subject: statistics
title: Unbiasedness and Consistency in Point Estimation
contentHtml:
In point estimation, we often seek to find an estimator that is both unbiased and consistent.

Unbiasedness ensures our estimate is on average correct, while consistency guarantees the estimate converges to the true value as the sample size increases.

theorem.statement: \[ \text{An estimator } \hat{\theta} \text{ is unbiased if and only if } \mathbf{E}[\hat{\theta}] = \theta. \]

subject: statistics
title: Unbiasedness of Estimators
contentHtml: In statistics, an estimator is said to be unbiased if its expected value equals the true parameter being estimated.

theorem.statement: \[\text{An estimator } \hat{\theta} \text{ is unbiased if and only if } \mathbf{E}[\hat{\theta}] = \theta.\]

intuition: Unbiasedness ensures that our estimate has no systematic error, which is crucial in making predictions or drawing conclusions.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, unbiased estimators are essential for avoiding bias in model training and evaluation.
